title: Nifty Auto Index had a Nice Jump Today on Positive Comments from Nitin Gadkari
text:
The broader market was almost flat today with increasing by just 0.03% and index declining by 0.22%. However, the standout performer was index, which spurted up by more than 2% in today’s trade. The index got a boost from a speech from Road transport and highways union minister Nitin Gadkari, who spoke at the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM).

He mentioned that the government is looking to cut taxes on hybrid vehicles after it has already announced cuts on electric cars. He also assured that petrol and diesel vehicles will not be banned in the future and even said that the tax rates on these vehicles need to come down.

His speech provided a shot in the arm to the auto stocks which has been under tremendous pressure over the last few months. Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. (NS: ) was up 2.5% while Tata Motors (NS: ) stock jumped by 8% in today’s trade. Despite this relief today, the Nifty Auto index has experienced a steep fall of 36% in the last one year. The main reason for this decline is the extraordinary fall in the sales of automakers. Maruti and Tata Motors recently announced a 33% and 58% decline in their vehicle sales for August on a year-over-year basis. Maruti even announced a two-day no-production at its Manesar and Gurugram plants on 7th and 9th September.

The government has acknowledged the troubles that the auto industry is finding itself in. A few days back, some relief to the auto sector in the form of lifting the ban on the purchase of new government vehicles to replace old vehicles. She also announced that the BS-IV vehicles bought before March 2020 would be allowed to remain operational for their registration period. However, the auto industry is desperately waiting for some decision from the government in the form of GST rate cuts on vehicles sales.
